intro: Curculigo leptostachya, commonly known as the slender-stemmed arrowhead, is a perennial herb native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes many flowering plants. The plant features a rhizomatous stem system and produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a spike. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth texture. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands.
